not_needed.title: ADAS Calibration Not Needed
not_needed.summary: Based on your answers, your vehicle either doesn't have ADAS features or hasn't had recent work that would require calibration.
not_needed.explanation: Your vehicle doesn't appear to have forward-facing ADAS features, or you haven't had recent windshield work that would require recalibration. What This Means: • No ADAS camera detected or vehicle is too old for these systems • No recent windshield work that would disturb camera alignment • Standard windshield service applies without calibration requirements If You Do Have ADAS: If your vehicle actually does have features like Auto Emergency Braking, Lane Keeping Assist, or Adaptive Cruise Control, retake this quiz and verify the camera location behind your rearview mirror. Future Windshield Work: If you ever need windshield replacement on a vehicle with ADAS, calibration will be mandatory. Always verify the shop has proper calibration equipment before proceeding.

mandatory.title: ADAS Calibration is MANDATORY
mandatory.summary: You've had windshield work without proper ADAS calibration. This is a critical safety issue.
mandatory.explanation: Your answers indicate you've had windshield work done on an ADAS-equipped vehicle, but calibration was either skipped, dismissed, or not mentioned. This is extremely dangerous. Why This is Critical: • Silent failure: ADAS systems won't trigger a warning light when misaligned, but they won't function correctly in an emergency • Manufacturer requirement: Nearly all automakers MANDATE calibration after windshield replacement • NHTSA standard: Federal safety regulators require proper calibration • Phantom braking risk: Misaligned cameras can cause unexpected braking or steering • Crash failure: Systems may not activate when needed, or may activate incorrectly The Science: • Even microscopic windshield position changes affect camera aim • 1° of misalignment = 8 feet off target at 100 feet distance • 0.6° misalignment = 60% reduction in automatic braking effectiveness • No warning light appears for misalignment—system simply won't work in a crash What You Must Do Immediately: Return to the shop that did your windshield work and DEMAND proper ADAS calibration. If they refuse or claim it's not necessary, they are demonstrating dangerous ignorance. Find an AGSC-certified shop with proper calibration equipment immediately.

urgent.title: Urgent: ADAS Calibration Required
urgent.summary: Warning lights or system malfunctions indicate your ADAS requires immediate attention.
urgent.explanation: Based on your answers, your ADAS is displaying warnings or behaving abnormally. This indicates the camera system is misaligned or malfunctioning and requires immediate professional attention. Warning Signs Detected: • ADAS warning lights or messages • Unexpected braking ("phantom braking") • Lane keeping system malfunction • Safety features stopped working The Danger: These symptoms indicate your vehicle's safety systems are not functioning as designed: • Phantom braking: Misaligned camera interprets false threats, causing unexpected braking that could cause a rear-end collision • Failed emergency braking: System may not activate when actually needed • Incorrect lane keeping: Could steer you out of your lane instead of keeping you in it • 0.6° misalignment = 60% reduction in braking effectiveness Possible Causes: • Recent windshield work without calibration • Collision or impact that shifted camera alignment • Suspension work or wheel alignment that changed vehicle geometry • Camera system fault or damage Required Action: Schedule ADAS calibration and diagnostic scan immediately. A professional technician with manufacturer-grade scan tools must perform pre-scan diagnostics, calibration, and post-scan verification.

recommended.title: ADAS Calibration Check Recommended
recommended.summary: Your vehicle has ADAS features that may benefit from calibration verification.
recommended.explanation: Based on your answers, your vehicle is equipped with ADAS features. While there's no immediate red flag requiring urgent calibration, a diagnostic check is recommended to ensure optimal system performance. Why Check Calibration: • Modern vehicles rely heavily on camera-based safety systems • Calibration can drift over time from road vibrations and temperature cycles • Recent minor repairs or impacts may have affected alignment • Diagnostic scan can identify issues before they become dangerous What to Expect: A professional ADAS diagnostic includes: • Pre-scan: Identifies any fault codes or system errors • Visual inspection: Checks camera mounting and lens condition • Static calibration: Uses manufacturer targets on level surface • Dynamic calibration: Test drive to verify real-world function • Post-scan: Confirms all systems operating correctly When to Schedule: • Before your next road trip • If you've had any recent collision or suspension work • If you notice any subtle changes in system behavior • As part of regular vehicle maintenance (annually) Not Urgent, But Important: While this isn't an emergency, proper ADAS function could be the difference between avoiding a crash and being in one. Peace of mind is worth the diagnostic cost ($75-150).
